body: Charles Henry Eaton is known primarily for his prize-winning water-colors.  He was a self-taught painter, who developed what some describe as a âsultry, low-toned style

, marvelously captures his low-toned style to the extent that you sense the last gasp of summer.  Eaton exhibited widelyâExposition Universelle; World's Columbian Exposition; American Water Color Society; Boston Art Club, Brooklyn Art Association; Lotos Club; National Academy of Design and the Western Art Association.

High auction record for this artist is $19,200.
dimensions: Oil on canvas, 14 x 20 inches / Signed lower left
